overview: Gulmarg is a small hill station in the Kashmir Valley (population ~2,000) famous for its lush summer meadows, wildflowers, and snow‑covered slopes in winter. It is a hub for winter sports, especially skiing, and features a high‑altitude cable car (gondola) that climbs to 3,995 m.
bestTimeToVisit: December to early April for skiing and winter sports; June to September for trekking, mountain biking and enjoying the summer meadows.
idealDuration: 2–3 days to experience the gondola, ski or trek, and explore the town.
topAttractions: Gulmarg Gondola (Stage One and Stage Two)
Skiing on the Gulmarg ski resort (including beginner and high‑altitude slopes)
Gulmarg Golf Course and surrounding meadows
Local markets selling carpets and Kashmiri crafts
travelTips: Take a bus from Tangmarg to Gulmarg (≈ INR 40) for the cheapest transport.
In winter hire a Jeep‑type vehicle (Scorpio, Qualis, Sumo) due to snow‑covered roads.
Carry warm woollen clothing, gloves, boots and overcoats; rentals are available in small shops on the way.
Book gondola tickets in advance at the Tourist Reception Centre (TRC) in Srinagar.
Bring your own ski equipment if you are an experienced skier; rentals are low‑quality and cost about INR 300 per day.
Beware of informal checkpoints and touts offering guide services; negotiate prices and verify credentials.
Walking is the main mode of getting around Gulmarg; the single road loop can be covered in about an hour.
Carry some cash for small purchases (e.g., sled rides ₹200) as card facilities are limited.
